intro: Peristylus monticola, commonly known as the mountain peristylus, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a rough texture. Peristylus monticola is adapted to grow in rocky and well-drained soils, often found in high-altitude environments.
